awd_titl_txt: Pulsatile Flow and the Susceptibility of Arteries to        Atherosclerosis
awd_abstract_narration: The goal of this project is to determine the role of unsteady fluid             dynamics in the initiation, progression, complication and possible              regression of atherosclerotic plaques.  Research will focus on unsteady         flow and early atherosclerotic lesions in three situations: the human           carotid bifurcation, the descending thoracic aorta of monkeys, and the          human abdominal aorta.  Fluid dynamics research will concentrate upon           unsteady flows in three-dimensional geometries, the evolution of                coherent and random flow disturbances during pulsatile flows, and               unsteady separation.  Biological research will investigate the                  quantitative distribution of early atherosclerotic lesions, the                 alignment of endothelial cells in bifurcating vessels, and the relation         between plaque composition and wall structure.
org_div_long_name: Division of Chemical, Bioengineering, Environmental, and Transport Systems
